skill.name: skill-share
skill.description: A skill that creates new Claude skills and automatically shares them on Slack using Rube for seamless team collaboration and skill discovery.
skill.summary: A skill that creates new Claude skills and automatically shares them on Slack using Rube for seamles...
skill.author: Joseph OBrien

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill with no executable code. All 17 static findings are false positives triggered by pattern matching on hash strings and documentation text. The skill contains only SKILL.md instructions and a metadata JSON file with no security risks.

content.user_title: Create and share Claude skills on Slack
content.value_statement: Creating Claude skills manually requires repetitive setup and lacks team visibility. This skill automates skill creation with proper structure and shares them on Slack for team discovery.
actual_capabilities: Create new Claude skills with proper directory structure
Generate SKILL.md templates with YAML frontmatter
Create standardized scripts, references, and assets directories
Validate skill metadata and naming conventions
Package skills into distributable zip files
Share skills on Slack channels via Rube
limitations: Requires Rube integration for Slack sharing
Does not execute or test created skills
Cannot publish skills to external registries

use_cases.title: Standardize Team Skill Templates
use_cases.description: Create consistent skill structures across your team. Automatically notify members when new skills become available.

use_cases.title: Automate Skill Distribution
use_cases.description: Build skill packaging into CI/CD workflows. Distribute skills automatically when builds succeed.

use_cases.title: Collaborative Skill Development
use_cases.description: Create skills and share them instantly with your team on Slack for feedback and iteration.

prompt_templates.title: Create Basic Skill
prompt_templates.scenario: Start a new skill project quickly
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a new Claude skill called pdf-analyzer with description: Extracts and analyzes text from PDF documents.

prompt_templates.title: Create Full Structure
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a skill named data-validator with description: Validates JSON data against schemas. Include scripts, references, and assets directories.

prompt_templates.title: Validate and Package
prompt_templates.prompt: Validate the skill at ./my-skill to ensure it meets requirements. Package it for distribution if validation passes.

prompt_templates.title: Complete Workflow
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a skill called api-tester, validate its structure, package it as a zip, and share it on the engineering Slack channel using Rube.

output_examples.input: Create a skill called pdf-analyzer for extracting text from PDF documents
output: Generated SKILL.md with required YAML frontmatter
Created scripts/ directory with run.sh template
Validation passed: All required fields present

output_examples.input: Share the data-validator skill on the dev-tools Slack channel
output: Team members can now download and install the skill

best_practices: Validate skills locally before sharing to ensure metadata completeness
Use hyphen-case naming consistently for all skill names
Include clear descriptions to help team members find relevant skills
anti_patterns: Sharing skills without running validation first
Using spaces or underscores instead of hyphens in skill names
Skipping the scripts directory when the skill requires executable code

faq.question: Which AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. All three platforms support skill-share for creating and distributing skills.

faq.question: What is Rube and why is it required?
faq.answer: Rube is an integration tool for Slack. It handles authentication and message posting. Configure Rube with your workspace before using Slack sharing.

faq.question: Can I use this without Slack integration?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill creation, validation, and packaging features work independently. Slack sharing is optional when Rube is configured.

faq.question: What happens if validation fails?
faq.answer: The skill reports which checks failed. Common issues include missing SKILL.md fields, invalid naming conventions, or missing required directories.

faq.question: Are there size limits for packaged skills?
faq.answer: Zip packaging has practical limits. Skills with large assets should be split into focused modules or reference external resources.

faq.question: Is my data transmitted during skill creation?
faq.answer: No. Skill creation happens locally. Data is only sent to Slack when you explicitly request sharing via Rube integration.
